text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- European fishing vessels withdraw from Moroccan waters for two months to allow recovery of fish stocks.
- Moroccan reservoirs filled to 71.9 percent of capacity after month of heavy rains.
- Police arrests Italian and Moroccan members of international network circulating stolen luxury cars in Marrakesh.
- European cold wave expected to spread in Morocco.
- Youth commits suicide by throwing himself under a train in Casablanca.
- Telecommunications utility cuts cost of phone calls to comply with international standards but it should also consider better services.
- Intense activity expected this year with elections, economic reforms and with education ministry's programmes targeting rural children.
